Package de.oth.blocklib.world.environment

Class CloudCluster

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.world.environment.CloudCluster
public class CloudCluster
extends java.lang.Object
The class CloudCluster holds all of the necessary information for a group of clouds that move in the same direction. Defines lots of constant values that are used in all kinds of methods to control random functions.
Author:
Sven Kalle

    • movementVector

      private org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f movementVector

  • Constructor Details

    • CloudCluster

      public CloudCluster​(int numberOfClouds, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f startPosition)
      A constructor taking only the number of clouds and the startPosition, giving the clouds a default movement vector of (0.01f, 0f, 0f)
      Parameters:
      numberOfClouds - - the amount of clouds that the CloudCluster should contain
      startPosition - - the position above which the clouds should spawn

  • Method Details

    • randomizedScale

      private org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f randomizedScale()
      Calculating a randomized scale for a cloud. Since clouds should be 1 block high, the scale is only randomized in x and z directions. Uses constants to control the random functions.
      Returns:
      Vector3f that contains a randomized scale for x and z directions, and 1 for y direction.

    • randomizedPosition

      private org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f randomizedPosition()
      Calculating a randomized X and Z position for a cloud inside its cloudCluster. Uses constants to control the random functions and repeats the position calculation if the cloud is too close to another cloud.
      Returns:
      Vector3f that contains a randomized Position.

    • randomizedDirection

      private org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f randomizedDirection()
      Calculating a randomized direction in X / Z direction. Math.random() delivers values between 0 and 1, So by multiplying by 2 and subtracting 1 the values range from -1 to 1 instead.

    • createCloudsOnClusterPosition

      public void createCloudsOnClusterPosition​(int numberOfClouds)
      Creating the specified amounts of clouds with randomized positions and scalings adding the player's position to make sure they are created within his range.
      Parameters:
      numberOfClouds - - amount of clouds that should spawn

    • updateCloudPosition

      public void updateCloudPosition​(float deltaTime)
      Updating the clouds position by adding the movement vector to the CloudCluster's Transformation. Since the individual clouds have their TransformationParent set to the CloudCluster's Transformation, they will move along.

    • checkForCloudDistances

      public void checkForCloudDistances()
      Checking for the distances of each cloud in the CloudCluster to see if it should be despawned if too far away. Uses the flat camera and cloud positions, meaning that the height does not matter, only the distance in x-z-direction.

    • calculateMovementDirection

      public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f calculateMovementDirection()
      Calculating the direction in which the spawned clouds should move. This is done by using the current position of the cloudCluster and the position of the camera + / - a given offset, so that it will move into a random direction that is roughly based on the player's position.
      Returns:
      Vector portraying the movement direction.

    • getAmountOfClouds

      public int getAmountOfClouds()
      Returns:
      Amount of currently active clouds of this cluster

    • setMovementVector

      public void setMovementVector​(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f vector)
      Set movement vector manually
      Parameters:
      vector - movementVector to be set

    • draw

      public void draw()
